rev.diff:
Line 435: Line 435:
{{*}}In '''Western Sahara''', young [[Sahrawis]] held a series of minor demonstrations to protest labour discrimination, lack of jobs, looting of resources, and human rights abuses.<ref name="Ref-1"/> Although [[2011 Sahrawi protests|protests]] from February 2011 onward were related to a series of [[2010 Sahrawi protests|Sahrawi demonstrations]] that originated in October 2010 and died down the following month, protesters cited inspiration from the events in other parts of the region. A few academics, notably [[Noam Chomsky]], viewed the October protests as the starting point from which 'the current wave of protests actually began'.<ref>{{cite web|url=http://english.aljazeera.net/programmes/empire/2011/02/20112211027266463.html|title=The genie is out of the bottle|date=21 February 2011[first published on Democracy Now! on 17 February 2011]|author=Noam Chomsky and Marwan Bishara|publisher=Al Jazeera}}</ref>
{{*}}In '''Western Sahara''', young [[Sahrawis]] held a series of minor demonstrations to protest labour discrimination, lack of jobs, looting of resources, and human rights abuses.<ref name="Ref-1"/> Although [[2011 Sahrawi protests|protests]] from February 2011 onward were related to a series of [[2010 Sahrawi protests|Sahrawi demonstrations]] that originated in October 2010 and died down the following month, protesters cited inspiration from the events in other parts of the region. A few academics, notably [[Noam Chomsky]], viewed the October protests as the starting point from which 'the current wave of protests actually began'.<ref>{{cite web|url=http://english.aljazeera.net/programmes/empire/2011/02/20112211027266463.html|title=The genie is out of the bottle|date=21 February 2011[first published on Democracy Now! on 17 February 2011]|author=Noam Chomsky and Marwan Bishara|publisher=Al Jazeera}}</ref>
